title: Psychiatric Drugs-Side Effects
body:
{{NEG}}Psychiatrists can predict what adverse side effects you might experience because they how their drugs work.
Psychotropic drugs are increasingly being exposed as chemical toxins with the power to kill.
{{NEG}}Psychiatrists claim their drugs save lives, and according to their own studies, psychotropic drugs can half the risk of suicide.
{{HEDGE}}And long-term use has sometimes created a lifetime of physical and mental damage, a fact ignored by psychiatrists.
Common and well-documented side effects of psychiatric drugs include mania, psychosis, hallucinations, depersonalization, suicidal ideation, heart attack, stroke and sudden death.
Not only that, but The US Food and Drug Administration admits that probably one to ten percent of all the adverse drug effects are actually reported by patients or physicians.
